data.title: Chris Sarandon Biography
data.meta_description: Read all about Chris Sarandon with TV Guide's exclusive biography including their list of awards, celeb facts and more at TV Guide.
data.text:
Fast Facts

Born in West Virginia to Greek parents

Met his future wife, actress Susan (Tomalin) Sarandon, while in college

Beginning in 1969, he played Tom Halverson on The Guiding Light

Made his Broadway debut in 1970 in the musical The Rothschilds, costarring Hal Linden and Robby Benson

Made his film debut in 1975's Dog Day Afternoon, opposite Al Pacino; his performance earned him Oscar and Golden Globe nominations

Other notable film roles include Prince Humperdinck in Rob Reiner's The Princess Bride (1987) and the voice of Jack Skellington in Tim Burton's The Nightmare Before Christmas (1993)
